body:
"In the U.R.F game mode (available in April 2014), Ryze was disabled in non-custom games. This was most likely due to his naturally low cooldowns combined with his passive, both of which led to locking one enemy in place and barraging him with spells with hardly any counterplay possible."

replies.body: I find it hilarious that when Ryze lost 25 base damage on Overload back when it was targeted, he was considered "unplayable", and "unhealthy" beforehand. I'm struggling to see how the new Ryze is anywhere near "healthy" in terms of game balance.

Ryze can't permanently go into URF mode, and spends most of his time in a state where he's weaker than most champions, which means his opponents can avoid him when he's strong and collapse on him when he's weak. His previous iteration was unhealthy because there wasn't any moment where he was especially stronger or weaker, and so led to this really flat power expression where he was either too weak to do anything or too strong to ever be approached, with no middle ground in-between. Currently, Ryze has an issue with being able to perma-root targets while empowered, which is obviously not healthy, but that's being fixed next patch via reductions to Arcane Mastery's uptime and Rune Prison's duration.

Here's why.
The old Ryze passive reduced cooldowns by like 2 before.
New passive reduces cooldowns by 4 each spellcast (scaling with overload's cooldown).
This means even more spellspam, and even more chain rooting, with a large mana shield to boot

What? They changed his E to reduce %MR, it was flat before. % Is worse than flat in almost every situation, the enemy would need to have over 200 MR for his new 12% shred to be better than the old 24 flat shred. The mana ratio on his E was doubled and it's a lot more reliable now, you don't have to hope for lucky bounces.
The movement speed on his ult wasn't changed.

Oh yeah, and his passive reduces cooldowns by like 4s instead of 1s when it's active. He can get off 4 snares in a row before the previous snare wears off, old Ryze couldn't even get close to that level of bs.
